III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility has not had any residents or staff during this period under review and does
not have an active contract. Therefore, there were no files to review, and thus, no
violations.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
In November 2020, the agency chose to voluntarily transfer all of the youth and staff
out of Donna Maria and Lourdes Halls and have not serviced youth under this license
since that time. If the agency decides to accept referrals on this license in the future,
they have agreed to notify me beforehand and I will provide consultation to address
any changes in programming and/or the terms of the license.
Vista Maria is currently considering a number of different programs for this license
based on the needs of potential contractors. In February 2021, I notified the chief
administrator that firm decisions on the direction of the license should made prior to
the expiration date of 04/08/23 or the license may not be renewed.
There were no DCWL investigations or corrective action plans submitted during this
licensing period and no substantiated abuse/neglect or corporal punishment.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is compliant with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility continue on their regular
license.
